channel.title: BSoD from... MSN?
channel.description:
Well, I was on MSN 8 (WLM 8... Maybe it was 8.5, but it wasn't the newest one.) the other day, like everyday, and decided to get some animated emotes. I Googled some and found a site with them, and they had them directly showing. For some reason (I don't know why), I decided to copy the GIF and paste it into my MSN, and when I did, I got a BSoD. (Blue Screen of Death for those who don't know. Basically, it's a screen that comes up when your computer crashes.)
I had my friend try it, and copy an emote from the same site I got mine from, and it sent every frame as a temporary image... However, he was using Windows Live Messenger 9 (The 2009 release), which was one release higher than the one I was using.
I posted this here in curiosity, because nothing came on Google for MSN BSoDs, caused by what I did. Has anyone else gotten one from the above? Perhaps it was just coincidence that it happened at the same time as some of my other hardware failed? Maybe it was because of my hardware... I'm just curious.
Also, I haven't tried it again. I don't enjoy attempting to crash my computer (Though it is rather exciting :)).
~Lin

item.title: BSoD from... MSN?
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

I just save them to my computer open up MSN and click the smiles and then show all, then I click “create” then “find Image”. And then go to where I saved the Emotion/Animation and click it and then open. And once you click open type the key that makes that Smile under it, and its name then click OK.

Read full topic

item.title: BSoD from... MSN?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:7, topic:282118”][quote author=Lin link=topic=372766.msg2813019#msg2813019 date=1244113326]
Windows[/quote]

There’s your problem!

On a serious note, if you want to display animations on msn, don’t directly copy and paste them. Save them and on the emoticon menu add them from your computer.

Can you recall what the screen said out of curiosity? I think you can check WINDOWS\System32\MEMORY.DMP[/quote]Yea, I know… I wanted to see how it’d turn out. Also, I don’t know what it said. I didn’t let it dump the memory either. And Windows doesn’t suck. Linux sucks.

[quote=“sanga282, post:8, topic:282118”]i use pidgin to avoid such issues[/quote]Was that one of the questions?

[quote=“Si Force, post:6, topic:282118”]It doesn’t happen me, although my friend has recently been getting bsod’s from MSN, will I ask him what was wrong/ how he solved it, for you?[/quote]I don’t get them daily, or for an unknown reason. I don’t care about fixing, so no.

Read full topic

item.title: BSoD from... MSN?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Lin:

Windows

There’s your problem!

On a serious note, if you want to display animations on msn, don’t directly copy and paste them. Save them and on the emoticon menu add them from your computer.

Can you recall what the screen said out of curiosity? I think you can check WINDOWS\System32\MEMORY.DMP

Read full topic
